settings.heading: 2025: Laying the Foundation
settings.row_content:
• Establish Organization: Officially recognized as a 501(c)(3) nonprofit.
  • Fundraising Initiatives: Secured initial funding to purchase aircraft.
  • Skill Development: Attended workshops and built foundational knowledge in aircraft construction.

settings.heading: 2025–26: Building the Zenith CH 750
settings.row_content:
• Fall 2025: Begin constructing the Zenith CH 750 aircraft.
  • Spring 2026: Complete assembly and conduct test flights with team members.
  • Post-Flight: Auction the completed aircraft at Princeton Reunions to reinvest in future projects.

settings.heading: 2026–27: Expanding Horizons
settings.row_content:
• Sustained Growth: Continue the cycle of purchasing, building, flying, and auctioning aircraft.
  • Collaborative Expansion: Establish similar clubs at other colleges to foster a nationwide network.
  • Enhanced Aircraft: Aim to build more complex aircraft designs with each cycle.

settings.heading: 2027–28: Pioneering New Frontiers
settings.row_content:
• Innovative Design: Develop a fully original aircraft designed by AeroPrinceton members.
  • Historic Race: Participate in the first-ever transcontinental collegiate air race featuring student-built planes.
  • Legacy Creation: Establish AeroPrinceton as a leader in student-led aviation initiatives.

settings.heading: February 2025
settings.row_content:
• Feb 8: Attended EAA Class for Riveting and Avionics in Virginia, gaining hands-on experience and networking with industry professionals.
  • Feb 22: Visited Teen Aviation NJ, learning about project planning and team management in aircraft construction.

settings.heading: March 2025
settings.row_content: • Mar 13: Engaged with Ignite Bentonville, discussing the importance of local partnerships with mechanics and FAA offices.

settings.heading: April 2025
settings.row_content:
• Apr 4: Launched our official website to share our mission and connect with supporters.
  • Apr 14: Held our first team meeting, marking the beginning of collaborative efforts.

settings.heading: May 2025
settings.row_content: • May 15–16: Built the plane's rudder at the Zenith Factory in Mexico, Missouri, under the guidance of CEO Sebastien Heintz and Chief Mechanic Roger Dubbert. Gained valuable insights into aircraft construction techniques and the simplicity of the Zenith Cruzer model.

settings.text: Your contributions are key to our future success. We are grounded without you!
